p: In elevated plus maze test, the aluminum chloride treated group showed significant increase in 1 st transfer latency and 2 nd transfer latency at day 21 and 42 respectively, with respect to initial transfer latency (ITL) at day 20, when compared with normal control group. Cardamom oil treatment at a dose of 100 and 200 mg/kg significantly prevented aluminum chloride induced increase in 1 st transfer latency and 2 nd transfer latency on day 21 ( p < 0.01) and 42 ( p < 0.001) when compared with disease control group. The cardamom oil treatment showed comparable results as that of donepezil hydrochloride treated group and improved the memory performance in animals ( Figure 3).
